text: if you're a shellfish lover
maybe you've steamed up a pot of mussels
before but you ever thought about
steaming clams at home they're actually
even easier than mussels they don't have
beards and they're so delicious when you
get your clams home the first thing you
want to do is give them a rinse with
cold water and if you do this so this is
damp this is damp these guys are gonna
last a lot longer never keep them in a
closed plastic bag in the fridge because
that'll suffocate them and that's bad
you just want to check and make sure
they're all really tightly closed so if
you see a clam that's open you know that
it died and then you don't want to cook
it because it could be off ya just want
to a little bit open so I'm going to
just toss these two and then cleaning
them is really easy run some water on
them and then just take a little scrub
brush and just scrub the sand off their
shells clams have so much liquid inside
them that I'm not even gonna add liquid
to this I'm just gonna saute some garlic
and some tarragon which is great with
clams so you want to get your pan nice
and hot before you add your oil and the
reason is because as your pan heats the
metal expands so that when you pour your
oil in it makes it extremely nonstick
just gonna add my garlic I sliced up my
garlic for this instead of mincing it
because I want the big pieces they taste
so good with the clams and then tarragon
which just makes everything taste fresh
and lovely and I'm just gonna cook this
for a couple of minutes just to give the

edges add my clams and cover the pot and
they're gonna steam really quickly 5 10
minutes if you're really cold right out
of the fridge but otherwise 5 just gonna
check them and aha they are mostly open
if you see any that don't open what you
can do is you can just leave those in
and try to cook them for another minute
or two and if they still don't open
that's when you throw them out yeah you

and all of that liquid in the bottom
that is your sauce I'm gonna add chili

some lime zest by the time is this lime
